thread.title: 'Incredibles 2' and 'Toy Story 4' hitting theaters soon
thread.title_full: 'Incredibles 2' and 'Toy Story 4' hitting theaters soon | www.daytondailynews.com

author: Hits 97.3 - Miami
title: 'Incredibles 2' and 'Toy Story 4' hitting theaters soon
text:
Disney has announced release dates for more than a dozen upcoming live-action and animated movies. “The Incredibles 2” and “Toy Story 4” are among those to hit theaters in the near future.
>> Read more trending stories
“Cars 3” and numerous untitled films have release dates scheduled into 2020.
Variety reports that the company also plans to release at least six Marvel films as part of its plans for the Marvel Cinematic Universe.
Here’s what Disney fans can look forward to:
Cars 3 (June 16th, 2017) Pixar's Coco (November 22nd, 2017) Untitled Disney Live-Action Fairy Tale Project (December 22nd, 2017) Gigantic (March 9th, 2018) Toy Story 4 (June 15th, 2018) Untitled Disney Live-Action Fairy Tale Project (November 2nd, 2018) Untitled Disney Live-Action Fairy Tale Project (March 29th, 2019) Untitled DisneyToons Studio Project (April 12th, 2019) The Incredibles 2 (June 21st, 2019) Untitled Disney Live-Action Fairy Tale Project (November 8th, 2019) Untitled Pixar Film (March 13th, 2020) Untitled Pixar Film (June 19th, 2020) Untitled Disney Animation Film (November 25th, 2020) According to Variety, Disney has earned $4 billion at the global box office, which beats its previous record by six weeks. As of Wednesday, the studio has earned $1.4 billion in the U.S. and Canada and $2.6 billion internationally.
